did.unittitle: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Video Recordings
did.abstract: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives at New York University, a special collection documenting the history of United States radicalism, labor, and progressive social action, accumulated this artificial collection of video recordings gradually over the years through purchases, donations, or separations from manuscript collections or organizational records in the library's holdings. The recordings document a wide range subjects concerning the history of the labor movement and leftist or progressive organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives at New York University, a special collection documenting the history of United States radicalism, labor, and progressive social action, accumulated this artificial collection of video recordings gradually over the years through purchases, donations, and separations from manuscript collections or organizational records in the library's holdings.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Researchers interested in using audiovisual materials in this collection (films, cassette tapes, VHS tapes, et cetera) must use a digitized copy, which we refer to as an access copy. Researchers may view an item's original container, but the media themselves are not available for playback because of preservation concerns. Materials that have already been digitized are noted in the collection's finding aid and can be requested in our reading room; materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. These requests are free of charge and can be made in anticipation of your visit. The process typically takes four to six weeks. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A librarian will respond to you with further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Because of the assembled nature of this collection, copyright status varies across the collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce these materials.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Collection of Video Recordings; VIDEOS 001; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Information about arrangement, description, and rehousing decisions prior to 2016 have not yet been recorded. In September 2016 an accretion of one videocassette was added to the collection and a collection-level finding aid was created.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of video recordings collected by the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wanger Labor Archives, or separated from manuscript collections or organizational records in the library's holdings. The recordings document a wide range subjects concerning the history of the labor movement and leftist or progressive organizations.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: There is no documentation concerning the provenance of several items in this collection. In August of 2016, Robert Cohen donated a videocassette of a lecture by Howard Zinn; the accession number associated with this gift is 2016.037.
